The van der Waals equation is given by: (P + a/V^2)(V - b) = RT
At the critical point, the following conditions hold: The first derivative of pressure with respect to volume at constant temperature is zero: (∂P/∂V)Tc = 0
The second derivative of pressure with respect to volume at constant temperature is also zero: (∂²P/∂V²)Tc = 0
These conditions ensure that the critical point is an inflection point on the P-V isotherm.
